snippet: Judges draw the line at awarding damages for emotional pain to owners who witness the deaths of their animals.
abstract: New Jersey Supreme Court rules that pet owners cannot sue for emotional distress when they witness the death of a pet, saying that state law limits such rights to cases concerning the death of human family members.
lead_paragraph: Judges draw the line at awarding damages for emotional pain to owners who witness the deaths of their animals.

headline.seo: New Jersey Supreme Court Bars Claims of Distress in Pet Deaths
headline.main: New Jersey’s Highest Court Bars Distress Claims in Death of Pets
headline.print_headline: New Jersey’s Highest Court Bars Distress Claims in Death of Pets
